title: UNIX Philosophy Pipe Diagram
description: An interactive visualization showing how small UNIX tools connect together via pipes to accomplish complex tasks, demonstrating the 'do one thing well' philosophy.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Computer Science
Operating Systems
Linux

learningObjectives: Understand the UNIX philosophy of small, composable tools
Visualize how data flows through a pipeline of commands
Apply the concept of pipes to combine commands in the terminal
Recognize the pipe symbol (|) as a connector between commands
prerequisites: Basic understanding of command line interface

accessibility: Screen reader description via describe() function

assumptions: Text streams are represented as document icons
limitations: Does not show actual command output
Does not demonstrate error handling or parallel processing
